comments.content: SSL VPN-Plus and IPsec VPN are compared here: https://pubs.vmware.com/vca/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.vmware.vca.ans.ng.doc%2FGUID-5FAA4CCC-C7E8-466F-8B78-F324E47DAED2.html

questions.question_text:
A group of users needs secured access to a set of web-based applications in a SDDC.
Which VPN option is best suited for this?
When running the NSX Control Plane in Hybrid Mode what are the minimum physical network requirements? (Choose three.)
Which two NSX roles could be used to create security policies? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Accorrding to "NSX Users and Permissions by Feature" the NSX Administrator has R,W permissions at security policies:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-Data-Center-for-vSphere/6.4/com.vmware.nsx.admin.doc/GUID-049478CE-681F-4FEE-B645-EC65ABC826A8.html

choices.A: Guest Introspection driver must be installed.
choices.B: Virtual Machine Data Collection must be enabled on the other VMs.
choices.C: NSX Manager must be linked to Active Directory
choices.D: Guest Introspection appliance must be deployed on the host.
Use IP address versus the DNS name in the Lookup Service
choices.C: Regenerate the SSL Certificate and reboot the NSX Manager
choices.A: Change the Port number from 7444 to 443
choices.B: Change the SSO Administrator User Name
